Re: Client Jeffrey Epstein (OUT OF OFFICE)
From
To
Date 2019/07/22 15:52
Subject: Re: Client Jeffrey Epstein (OUT OF OFFICE)
I will be out of the office for the remainder of the day Monday, July 22, 2019, returning on Tuesday, July 23, 2019, and I will not have access to my email during this time. Please contact Supervisory Attorney [b)(6, (b)(7)(C) or Staff Attorney (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) if you require immediate assistance. Thank you.
(b)(6), (b)(7)(C)
CLC New York
Metropolitan Correctional Center
150 Park Row
New York, NY 10007
(P) 646-836-(F) 646-836-7665
>>> (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) 7/22/19 15:52 >>>
Good afternoon (b)(6), (b)(7)(C)
I have forwarded your concerns to MCC administrators for consideration. I will get back to you as soon as I can.
Thank you,
(b)(6), (b)(7)(C)
Supervisory Staff Attorney
CLC New York
Metropolitan Correctional Center
150 Park Row
New York, New York 10007
p: (646)836-f: (646)836-7665
>>> Mariel Colon 7/22/2019 12:34 PM >>>
Good morning Mr. (b)(6), (b)(7)(C)
I tried calling you earlier. My client, Jeffrey Epstein (76318-054) informed me that he had a meeting last Friday with (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) and Mr. Pluorde, where Mr. Pluorde told our client that he would be allowed to use the bathroom once every hour on the third floor when meeting his attorneys. Yesterday, Officer (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) told my client and I that he would not be allowed to use the bathroom unless a Lieutenant could come or unless he sees a memo from Lieutenant (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) or Mr. Pluorde allowing the staff to allow our client to use the bathroom. Can Mr.

Good morning Mr. (b)(6), (b)(7)(C)
I tried calling you earlier. My client, Jeffrey Epstein (76318-054) informed me that he had a meeting last Friday with (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) and Mr. Pluorde, where Mr. Pluorde told our client that he would be allowed to use the bathroom once every hour on the third floor when meeting his attorneys. Yesterday, Officer (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) told my client and I that he would not be allowed to use the bathroom unless a Lieutenant could come or unless he sees a memo from Lieutenant (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) or Mr. Pluorde allowing the staff to allow our client to use the bathroom. Can Mr.
